channel.title: Installing Xp
channel.description:
okay so i currently have vista on my desktop and i wanted to dual boot it so i could have xp and vista.. so i burned the xp copy onto a cd since it fitted on a cd i burnt it on there.. so i put in the cd n restart my computer so i could boot into the cd and install xp on my new partition. but when i restart it doesnt boot into the cd.. it goes straight into vista like usuall. I also checked the BIOS setup but i couldnt find anything in there.
so i was just wondering why exactly is this happening ? thanks

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

i acutallly burnt it onto the cd, im not that dumb to copy and paste haha =D

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Well sort of. You have to use both.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:10, topic:288537”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=381473.msg2868175#msg2868175 date=1247586249]
I had them both installed on my laptop, along with linux. It wasn’t really a pain because I used GRUB as a bootloader, you could do the same I suppose.

Also, did you actually burn the iso to the CD? Or did you just copy and paste in on there? Because the latter is not going to work.
[/quote]
He was only mentioning Vista/XP boot (which wouldn’t use Grub) :P[/quote]

He could still use grub, either with a boot partition, or with win-grub.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:288537”]I had them both installed on my laptop, along with linux. It wasn’t really a pain because I used GRUB as a bootloader, you could do the same I suppose.

Also, did you actually burn the iso to the CD? Or did you just copy and paste in on there? Because the latter is not going to work.[/quote]
He was only mentioning Vista/XP boot (which wouldn’t use Grub)

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I had them both installed on my laptop, along with linux. It wasn’t really a pain because I used GRUB as a bootloader, you could do the same I suppose.

Also, did you actually burn the iso to the CD? Or did you just copy and paste in on there? Because the latter is not going to work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

lol yeah i heard if u have vista first and then want to install xp as a dual boot its a pain in da ass… ?

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Dual booting off the same disk is a pain in the ass, especially with Windows. Just use two disks.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

You will need to fix the vista MBR after.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

darkilla:

escape and f12 or either of them ??

It is usually F12, some are ESC or even F8. Every BIOS manufacturer is different.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

escape and f12 or either of them ??

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Xp
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Press the escape/f12 character on the keyboard, that should bring up the boot device menu.

Read full topic

so i put in the cd n restart my computer so i could boot into the cd and install xp on my new partition.
